docs.abstract: The Pentagon said Iran fired more than a dozen ballistic missiles at the Asad and Erbil bases in Iraq, where American troops are stationed.
docs.snippet: The Pentagon said Iran fired more than a dozen ballistic missiles at the Asad and Erbil bases in Iraq, where American troops are stationed.
docs.lead_paragraph: A sprawling air base in western Iraq that hosted President Trump during his first visit to a combat zone as commander in chief was one of two military installations where American troops are stationed that came under ballistic missile attack by Iran early Wednesday.

headline.main: What We Know About the 2 Bases Iran Attacked

docs.abstract: Freestyle rice and beans is great to cook when you’re a little jumpy and unfocused, working on autopilot.
docs.snippet: Freestyle rice and beans is great to cook when you’re a little jumpy and unfocused, working on autopilot.
docs.lead_paragraph: Good morning. I was on the road the last few days and there wasn’t as much cooking as I’d have liked but the eating was grand: Josh Berry’s butter-aged steak at Union in Portland, Maine; the almond croissants Michelle Berry makes at Moonbat in Belfast; pretty much the whole menu at Jon Merry’s River House in Damariscotta. I topped it all off with a gallon of gas-station coffee and powered my way back home through snow flurries and potholes: 20 hours of driving in a little more than 36, a tombstone every mile.

headline.main: You Don’t Need a Recipe, Part XVII

docs.abstract: In Beirut, the fugitive ex-Nissan chairman made his first public comments since he fled Japan at news conference and in an interview with The New York Times.
docs.snippet: In Beirut, the fugitive ex-Nissan chairman made his first public comments since he fled Japan at news conference and in an interview with The New York Times.

headline.main: Carlos Ghosn, Mum on Tokyo Escape, Unleashes a Rambling Defense
headline.print_headline: ‘I Did Not Escape Justice. I Fled Injustice.’

docs.abstract: A study examined a popular approach that coordinated care for the most expensive patients, and found that the project did not reduce hospital admissions.
docs.snippet: A study examined a popular approach that coordinated care for the most expensive patients, and found that the project did not reduce hospital admissions.
docs.lead_paragraph: In the quest to reduce health care spending in the United States, the idea held incredible promise: By addressing the medical and social needs of the most expensive patients, you could keep them out of the hospital.

headline.main: These Patients Are Hard to Treat
headline.print_headline: Helping the Most Expensive Patients Fails to Keep Them Out of the Hospital
